title: England v Australia: fifth and decisive men’s cricket one-day international – live
summary:
• Live updates from final ODI of series in Bristol, tied 2-2
  • England’s female cricketers land 30% pay rises | Mail Tim

Morning everyone and welcome to the last stop on a long and winding road. It’s the end of the home international cricket season, the final act of the drama, the fifth set of the match. It could be anything from a cliffhanger to a damp squib.

England have to beat Australia for the third time in a week to complete a barnstorming comeback. Australia have to remember how experienced they are and put these upstarts in their place. And both sides have to beat the weather, which is looking dodgy all day and downright dismal from mid-afternoon.

Continue reading...

title: Arteta explains Man City comments after Pep called for clarity
summary: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta has explained his comments about Manchester City's  tactics - clarifying that he knows "everything" about them because of how hard Pep Guardiola's players and staff work.

title: PL hits and misses: Palmer makes history, Arsenal become title favourites
Ten Hag vs Ange: Trophy 'trap' or sustainable success?
summary: Ange Postecoglou thinks there's more to being successful as a top-level manager than just winning trophies, with "sustainable success" his aim at Tottenham.

title: Pep irked by Rodri questions and addresses Haaland 'knocks'
summary: Pep Guardiola became frustrated by repeated questions about Rodri after Man City's 1-1 draw at Newcastle, insisting his side's performance without the injured midfield ace was "exceptional".

title: 'It's got to stop' - Neville slams Wolves' tactics in Liverpool defeat
summary: Gary Neville slammed Wolves' approach in the final stages of their 2-1 defeat to Liverpool at Molineux on Saturday Night Football, suggesting they had "lost the essence of football."

title: Livingstone makes history as England dominate Australia in 186-run win
summary: Liam Livingstone made history with the quickest ODI half-century at Lord's as England cruised to a 186-run win over Australia in the fourth ODI, levelling the series at 2-2.

title: Broad: Livingstone shows England selectors his ODI worth
summary: Liam Livingstone's blistering 62 not out has shown the England selectors why he should be part of the white-ball squads, says former quick Stuart Broad.
